review.title: BCG DAYS INN
review.reviewText: Room was not at all convenient. The 2 rooms were not of same size. Roaches & Bed bugs present. AC very noisy.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. Very near to all important places.
review.negativeRemarks: The Hotel requires a total cleanup and change of all the furniture and carpets and beds.
review.locationRemarks: Location is the only plus point. All places are nearby.

review.reviewText: Hotel steps and outside were filthy and messy. Room very small and smelled moldy and dusty. Air conditioner vent filthy so we couldn't turn it on.  Bed coverings old,frayed and dusty. Offered breakfast but equipment so dirty I would not eat there. We did not stay second night but had to pay for it since we reserved it ahead with Expedia.I found another hotel that was clean. Oh, beds were very uncomfortable with wadded up bunches of mattress. I would never stay there again.I would like a credit for the night we paid for and could not stay.The manager was rude and not helpful. I ask for more towels and he said the laundry was closed until morning. The later he brought towels.
review.negativeRemarks: everything
review.locationRemarks: location was ok

review.title: The place close the golden gate bridge, and more.
review.reviewText: Easy parking on the down town place. Worry  free transportation.

review.title: Terrible experience
review.reviewText: Terrible service, no parking for my vehicle, had to park across the street, had my mirror stolen. I will never book this hotel again.
The hotel was a bit shady and the owner/operator was very rude to a customer in front of me.  Not the best neighborhood.  Lucky I was alone and did not have the family with me.

review.title: Find another place!
review.reviewText: We forfeited our $300+ Non-refundable reservation. There were homeless people outside on a busy busy street, got hit up by a drug addict, staff were rude, room was worse than used frat house furniture, smelled old and musty, parking was horrible (to tight) and if you were unlucky enough to return late = double parking. The cleaning "guy" leared at me - creepy. There wasn't one redeeming quality about this place.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: It was good stay , only sleept their not to far from the marina , nice walk
Internet connection is terrible, on and off every 2 minutes. They stopped serving breakfast at 8:00am. Parking lot is very hard to get in or out.

review.title: Nice hotel. Walking distance to restaurants
review.reviewText: Clean room and accomendations. Once you park, you stay put or lose your parking space. Other than that, the place should be visited, to upgrade it's class to 3 star motel.

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice ,parking included . clean ,newly renovated ,nice flat screen tv ,quiet ,microwave,refrigerator

review.title: Not as expected
review.reviewText: Three things I was not happy with. Office doors was locked after 11pm. No parking was available in the hotel. I was told by the staff that it was OK to park on the streets. Not being from the area and every street needed a permit, I was affrad to get a ticket. That is why I had to get up very early to check on the err car. Finally, Office was still locked around 7am. And was not sure when the breakfast will start.

review.title: Poor housekeeping standards
review.reviewText: On arrival, we were given wrong directions to room. Bathroom was dirty with previous guest's soap and hair in tub, moldy shower curtain. Coffeemaker had someone's old packet of coffee in filter, housekeeping never replenished our cups so ww had to get our own from the front desk. There was fruit only one of four days for the free breakfast. Front door stuck, hard to open/close. Staff didn't seem to care whether we were happy or not. Great location, but we will never stay here again since there are so many other places to stay in this area.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Great location,  quiet,  comfortable, good parking. We just used it to sleep and it served our needs great.  I'd stay again.

review.title: Close to city sights
review.reviewText: The location is perfectly close to everything you would want to walk to. But the washroom could use a little upgrading i.e the fan doesnt work, walls has water damage, and also carpet needed to be clean more often. Other than that, we loved how close it was to everything.

review.title: Overpriced with appalling service.
review.reviewText:
We chose this hotel purely on the basis of available car parking and reasonable cost, however the car park was small and cramped, with too few spaces for the number of rooms. We daren't use the car for fear of losing our space, and we were blocked in on our check-out day by another guest. The so-called breakfast was the most basic of prepackaged bread, and coffee, however we were not able to even partake of this as the office did not open until 8am (despite staff members being present), and we were told to go away and come back later, which was not possible as we had excursions arranged. The most appalling attitude prevailed from each member of staff, from our check in, right throughout our stay, as though guests were a downright nuisance to them, and they would all clearly rather be doing other things than dealing with the running of the hotel. 

We loved San Francisco, but would rather pay considerably more to avoid this hotel in the future and we would not recommend it to others. The shortcomings of the property could be offset to some extent by improving the customer experience, but I doubt that this will be likely unless a change in management is made.
review.negativeRemarks: Wholesale change in management/staff/attitude. Clarity in relation to car park size/office opening/breakfast/check-in time, at time of booking.
review.locationRemarks: Good central location to many San Francisco attractions.

review.title: The housekeep was ok
review.reviewText: We wait for hotel check it but room not be rally tell 4:00  is was ok !

review.title: Close to area but...
review.reviewText: Terrible customer service and staff. Woke up early just to leave this motel.

review.title: Great couple of days here!
review.reviewText: This stay was far better than I expected. First off, the room was in a great location. We walked to a couple of places. Took an uber and lyft to a couple of other spots. Walk to bused weren't far. Beds were comfortable! Rooms were clean. Also, the staff is very accommodating and the manager is awesome. He was really friendly and helpful to us and we appreciated that. I really enjoyed my stay here and so did my friends. We went for a girls trip for a birthday and it was worth it! The only thing is that our TV didn't work which we could deal with because we were out and about so much. Other than that, we really enjoyed our stay and plan on coming back here again. Side note: walk to the Palace of Fine Arts, it's about a five minute walk. Fisherman's Wharf about a thirty minute walk.
Staff very pleasant. Room was clean and comfortable. Restaurants within walking distance. Better than expected,considering the relatively low cost. Would stay there again.

review.title: Just ok
review.reviewText: While the room was ok, the staff were rude and not helpful in the least. Stayed 14 hour, about 8 too many.

review.title: Rundown hotel w/terrible customer service
review.reviewText: Location is terrible, customer service is worst and breakfast is just coffee/juice and packaged pastries. We arrived around 11pm and they had us stand out in the cold and terrible neighborhood to check in. A ton of homeless sleeping outside hotel and didn't feel safe.

review.title: SFO hotel.
review.reviewText: Room/bathroom was not very clean, location is good, breakfast simple.

review.title: Days Inn Lombard
review.reviewText: We were in need of a cheap hotel for an extended layover in San Francisco.  We wanted a location that was close to the Wharf and some of the other attractions and have stayed at other Days Inns in the past because they are a decent, inexpensive motel, with a good free breakfast.  I think this may have been the tiniest motel room we have ever stayed in, which was somewhat understandable because we were right in the middle of the city.  Overall, it was okay, but we wouldn't stay again.  The location is great.  Walking distant to many restaurants, the Golden Gate Bridge, and the Wharf.  The rooms were super tiny though, the bed a bit hard, and the Free breakfast consisted of coffee, juice, and packaged pastries.  Every other Days Inn has bagels, toast, cereal, and WAFFLES (which s what I was looking forward to).  Also, when we stopped for our free breakfast on Sunday before we checked out, the reception area where the breakfast was located, was locked!  So, we walked down the street and had breakfast.  Also, on their website they state they they have a shuttle to the airport.  Somewhere I saw that it was $15 one way, which is a great deal!  We were charged $20 per person, which isn't horrible, but wasn't expected.  It took 3 attempts for us just to book the shuttle, so were glad to just get it booked.  Overall, an okay stay, but not up to par with other Days Inn motels.
review.negativeRemarks: Reception staff, breakfast, room size, bed comfort.
review.locationRemarks: The Golden Gate Bridge is close by, lots of great restaurant choices nearby.  Fisherman's Wharf is within walking distance, but about a 30 min walk.

review.title: Comfortable and affordable
review.reviewText: Nice little motel, clean rooms, friendly staff. On public transport route, walking distance to lots of restaurants, bridge, piers and other attractions. A little noisy and poor wifi signal in back rooms. Comes with coffee machine in room and fruit, juice and breakfast pastries available in the morning. Overall recommended for family stay.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: For what you pay, it is great!! Close to great food and shopping. Close to Golden Gate Bridge. The room was in amazing shape! Clean, nicely decorated, and quiet. The only drawback to me was that the bed was a bit hard. But some people like that. I would stay here again!

review.title: dirty dirty room. Under the bed,carpets very filth
review.reviewText: Very low budget place to stay great location to purchase eour distenation. Good location. Don't count on their breakfast at all.
The hotel was in walking distance to a lot of places and some restuarants too. The room was just what we needed.

review.title: Modest accommodation
review.reviewText: Clean,  good location & the price is great for San Francisco!
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast!
review.locationRemarks: It is an easy town to get around, muni stops 1 block away.

review.title: HORRIBLE Hotel!!!
review.reviewText: I would never stay here again, and would never recommend anyone stay here. We stayed 4 nights, and we could never get anyone to clean our room even just once. It took 3 trips down to the front desk just to get clean towels. The "contintental breakfast" that is advertised consists ONLY of pre-packaged pastries that I can buy at any gas station. One time there was green bananas that couldn't even be pealed. The room smelled awful, and I was extremely nautious the first night of our stay. I almost threw up a couple of times. Also, the hotel advertised 'airport transportation'. Don't let this fool you, there is none. I was stuck at the airport calling the hotel, and they say "Nope, we don't have transportation from the airport". I tell them that it says they do on their website, and their response was "oh, it shouldn't say that on the website." The staff was pretty much useless and made you feel like you were interrupting them every time you needed something. It took an extensive amount of time and work for me to get a roll of toilet paper. Horrible hotel!!! I would NOT recommend staying here.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything.
review.locationRemarks: The location was the ONLY good thing. Right downtown on Lombard Street, close to many nice restaurants and the bus stop that goes to many places.

review.title: nice restaurants around
review.reviewText: The room was clean and beds were comfortable. For the price it was good. It is not a romantic place for a couple. Parking spaces are small and little hard to park. Forget about the free breakfast. They don't have much to offer.

review.title: Needs repairs and updating
review.reviewText: Motel decor was dated.  Heater in room did not work (temp outside was below 40 degrees), staff tried to fix it with a screwdriver but was not successful.  No other rooms available, therefore was given extra blankets for the night.  Tub drain was not working and therefore held water while you showered.   WiFi practically non-existent.   Staff apologized and offered 10% discount......still waiting on it while Expedia verifies with motel management.
review.positiveRemarks: Central location.  Walking distance to IHOP

review.title: A nightmare hotel
review.reviewText: Since we arrived was wrong, we were treated on the street, we were assigned an unheated room, dirty and without internet! they would not ever move rooms was terribly cold, we almost froze! Hotel staff extremely rude and not friendly

review.title: Bad experience
review.reviewText: The coffee machine did not work. The main problem was heater, it was so cold in SF and heater did not work. It's seems like manager was aware that heater was broken so instantly offer more blanket or refund the money.

review.title: free parking= metering on street, no change bed
review.reviewText: free parking means parking on metered street, No staff at all, free breakfast=a plastic wrapped cooking, they do not change the bed-sheet, toilet is airplane toilet, loud!!!  the coffee machine never clean with old coffee bean in it. basically, you got a room on yourself like homeless shelter
review.negativeRemarks: service
review.locationRemarks: none

review.reviewText: The only best thing about this hotel is location. It is nearest to all the visiting places. Rest all is not great or good. Please don't have much expecatition with this hotel. I find the staff is helpful and always ready to guide. Food near by is good also close to all major places. Hotel comfort needs lot of improvement.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: Great location however the breakfast provided could do with I bit of better thought and variety
review.negativeRemarks: Type of breakfast provided. The rest of the hotel is very clean and tidy.
review.locationRemarks: Close to fishermans wharf and other sights.

review.title: The toilet had a loud motor sound from the tank
review.reviewText: The toilet had a loud motor sound from the tank. I had to shut the door to sleep. Overall it was ok but I won't stay there again. What does the owner think? I think it needs repairs. Terrible to put a customer in there.

review.title: Excellent service and location
review.reviewText: The service was excellent and the facilities were just what I needed.  Staff is friendly.  Parking area is a tad cramped.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking area.

review.title: Recommended
review.reviewText: Fantastic location to local restaurants and the staff were friendly and helpful.

review.title: The worse service I've ever received
review.reviewText: When I checked in the hotel, the manager at the front desk told me that the room that I'm getting doesn't have AC, so I asked is the heater working and i also told him that as long the heater is working then I'm fine with it.  After all it's in San Francisco and it gets really cold in November at night.  I thought he said yes, so he gave the room key.  I went to my room and the room is clean, went to turn on the heater and the heater wasn't working.  I called the front desk and it was busy, so I went back down to the front desk and the manager that helped me earlier had stepped out and the lady said she will talk to him to see if they can switch us to a different room or at least find a space heater.  I told the lady that I'm ok with the space heater.  Went back to my room and the manager called me back and he said he told me that there's no heater in that room, if I want a room with a heater then I have to pay $30 to "upgrade" my room.  I told him that am not going to pay anymore than what I had to on Expedia, he told me the price advertised on Expedia doesn't including AC & heating.  I asked him that "are you kidding me?"  That should be a standard accommodations that come with the room and he said no.  I told him I will call Expedia and he said go ahead and call them, he can offer me extra blanket for free, but if I don't want to pay to upgrade then stay in that room and hung up on me.  I had no choice but to stay there and layer up to get through the cold night.
review.negativeRemarks: They could have switched me to a room with a proper working heater, but they wouldn't, they just want more money out of me. It ruined my SF experience

review.title: Decent hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: At the last minute, this was the cheapest hotel I found close to the Fisherman's Wharf. I do not recommend this hotel for families. The room, bathroom, and queen sized beds were too small. I don't like the fact that the hotel does not have a front desk clerk early in the morning. You have to press a button to ring an employee that is staying in a room next door. The hotel is family-owned. Parking should only be for hotel customers. The hotel should provide one-day parking tickets or however many days the customer is staying. Someone was parking in the handicapped who was not handicapped. It is not fair and frustrating for customers who come from out-of-town and cannot find a parking.
review.positiveRemarks: Free parking and the low price.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking should only be for hotel customers. The hotel should provide one-day parking tickets or however many days the customer is staying.
review.locationRemarks: I enjoy the location of the hotel. It is near everything and I love how there are many restaurants within walking distance.

review.title: Lots of restaurants near bye
review.reviewText: Great place to stay for price . Parking lot great. ..

review.title: Scared, loud, filthy hotel!
review.reviewText: We booked this hotel thinking it was close to fisher and warf ( was not) parking was horrible. A few spots that took ten min to get in and out of they were so close together. If you leave, your spot won't be there spin return and you'll have to pay for parking.....if you find it. Room was filthy dirty, stained bedding and linens. The gross small room was extremely loud( sounded like we were on Broadway) we tryed to turn on air unit just to diffuses noise, it didn't work and the rug was soaking wet. Moldy bathroom , we slept in our clothes and didn't use shower. It was a night mare....... Scared and NO sleep.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything.

review.title: Bad Experience in Every Way
review.reviewText:
This motel will offer nothing to you but disappointment. They claim services that they do not offer. For instance, a working AC. Upon entering, my husband was greeted with an uncomfortably warm room. The AC had an error code displayed on its screen. He looked up the error code and alerted the front desk staff. They did nothing.

He contacted them again when he noticed that his room phone was flashing as if there was a message. He was told not to worry about that; it was just broken. It flashed away all night. There was some sort of sensor (smoke alarm?) on the wall that was wrapped in a plastic bag so that it would not be able to sense a thing. To compensate for the rising temperature of the room, my husband opened the window to let in some outside air. The area around the hotel is quite loud though, and this made sleeping impossible.

Additionally, the hotel does not have an adequate number of parking spaces. If you choose to leave in the evening to get dinner, you run the risk of not having anywhere to park. The wifi code was not provided upon check-in, and no one was available to supply it until they returned to the front desk much later. This left my husband with the 9 channels on the tv for his sole entertainment. In the morning, the motel supposedly offered free breakfast. That was not available when my husband left for his conference at 7:55. They never fixed the AC, so he checked out 2 days early. They refunded nothing. They lied to Expedia, saying the AC was fixed.
review.negativeRemarks: Literally everything... Also, when services are so disappointing that your guests check out early, refund the remaining days.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco has much to see. See it from a different hotel.

photos.caption: Of pastries, watered down coffee, and the juice machine did not work!

review.title: DO NOT STAY HERE!
review.reviewText: Expedia lists this hotel as having free parking, continental breakfast, and wifi.... None is true! There is around 10 parking spots but the hotel management is parked in 4 spots! Continental breakfast was old Danishes and watered down coffee!  We could never connect to wifi... This place is a joke! Management is rude!  Not to mention the stench billowing in to the reservation desk from their lliving quarters!

The Hotel is in a good location and the staff were pleasant.  The rooms are what you would expect from  a 2 -star hotel.  The linens were clean which is the most important part and the room and bathroom were clean.  Downsides, there was a dresser in the closet so you could not hang out your clothes properly, this required a bit of furniture moving. 

If the owners would take just a bit of time in fixing this, this would be a great value location.

review.title: Book your stay at another hotel
review.reviewText: I really would like to have left positive feedback....I paid enough. In town for a concert, only needed a bed and a shower. The bed was extremely hard. If that was the least of my worries, I would have rated higher. Oh, no. No Wi-Fi service available, well, I guess it was available but the login and password provided did not work...still, least of my worries. Tried sleeping but it seems the bathroom vanity light decided it wanted to flicker and hum throughout the night for no apparent reason and yes, I shut the door...didn't stop from waking me periodically throughout the night. Then, I wake up to find the shower does NOT work. The tub only drains if you hold the plug down the entire time it empties. Parking is horrible. Although I didn't not reserve a handicapped room, I am disabled, arrived that evening to find that the only disabled spot in the tiny lot was taken by a non-disabled person. Mgmt obviously didn't care as they were not asked to move. Won't stay here again, won't recommend it to anyone and if you're smart, you'll book some where else.
review.negativeRemarks: Ensuring that everything works properly in the room before renting them out.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco park, Wharf, Pier 39, Golden Gate Bridge, Ocean Beach, AT&T Park

review.title: Awful
review.reviewText: Situated on a very busy road which our room faced onto, other rooms may be quieter. The carpet in the room had an inch wide boarder of dirt/grime where the Hoover has never been. The air con unit wouldn't work. There was no safe so it was decision time when leaving the room whether to leave valuables unsecured or risk carrying them around. The room has light switches with movement sensors which make sleep impossible as the slightest movement activates a bright green led light which turns the room into a discotheque. I would not recommend.
review.negativeRemarks: As above
review.locationRemarks: On a very busy road

review.title: Decent hotel on motel row
review.reviewText: Stayed there for days...the room was adequate size for a major city....breakfast choices were very limited...just pastries juice and coffee...pretty centrally located and easy to get to major sites

review.title: OK, but will look for an alternative next time.
review.reviewText: Ended up with a singe double bed after reserving and dual queen room at an additional charge and no adjustment to price.  Office was normally still locked when I attempted to get the continental breakfast.
review.positiveRemarks: Lower relative rate to San Francisco hotels, nearby restaurants, and bus routes
review.negativeRemarks: Ensure continental breakfast is available without having to ring bell and wait for hotel staff.
review.locationRemarks: restaurants and Fisherman's Wharf nearby

review.title: Hotel located in a sketchy section of the city.
review.reviewText: I had a room that was prepaid to be able to get a discount so there was no refund.  When I got there the location was dirty with a tire shop beside it and surrounded by many abandoned stores.  When I checked in the guy at the front desk to me before the other gentleman since I had a reservation.  Gave me my key and when I went to the room the door lock was not working.  You could open the door without having to swipe the key.  I went to the front desk to complain and the guy told me to just leave my stuff in the room that he would watch it from here and he would fix it later.  I argued back and forth with him because I did not feel comfortable leaving my valuables in a unsecured room which he did not even have a direct line of sight to the room.  Since it was prepaid, I was not able to request a refund or I would have and gone some place else.  The guy at the front was rude and he was telling me that he had no other room and nodding his head as I stood there.  Since I stood my ground, he turned and said all he had was a room with 2 beds which I said I was fine with.  The room was clean but you could hear the cars and trucks passing by all night long and the a/c sounded like a truck engine.  The breakfast was a joke.  The small front desk had a desk where they had pastries and juice machine that seems like it was never used because there was no cups around.  So saying that you include Continental breakfast is the description is not an accurate description.
review.negativeRemarks: Lower your prices to adequately reflect the quality of hotel you are offering and improve your breakfast.

review.title: Very accommodating!!
review.reviewText: There were 5 of us on motorcycles, 3 with trailers. We arrived at the hotel at 10:30 am and they allowed us to park all the bikes in their parking all day. Very nice since parking in San Fran is hard to find and afford. They kept an eye on the bikes and had our rooms cool and ready when we returned from site seeing later that evening. They advised of an excellent restaurant up the street for breakfast and even offered a ride to the wharf! Very happy. The hotel was surprisingly quiet for the area. Great location!

review.title: In a good location only a couple miles from landm.
review.reviewText: The room was good for the price, the walls in the room were kind of dirty but the overall feel of it wasn't. The guy at the desk was really nice he let us park way early and check in so I could use the restroom after a 6 hour drive. I would stay there again.

review.title: Good location but thats it...
review.reviewText:
Unfriendly, lazy staff hardly speaking any English. breakfast consists of Bad coffee and low cost pastries. Standard and Services are too low.... even the price is alright...
Never again.
review.negativeRemarks: Change personnel..,..
review.locationRemarks: Ok

review.title: Indifferent desk staff
review.reviewText:
Our reservation sheet stated a 2 p.m. check-in time. We'd just flown cross-country & were tired & ready for a shower. We arrived at 2, but were told the room wouldn't be ready until 3-3:30. No apology (until we actually checked-in later) & a statement that check-in time was only an estimate & not guaranteed.

Never hasn't been anywhere else we've ever stayed.

The hotel advertised free parking, which was a selling point. The parking was tight, but, that was not their fault. However, the 2nd day, we had gone out early & returned about 4 p.m. to find that there were NO parking spaces available. Again, we were told that parking was not guaranteed,  we'd have to park on the street, at our cost. When we left for dinner, around 6 (once parking is free on the street), we were shouted down to tell us that there would be parking available again after 6. 

Not that things don't go wrong, but, the indifference shown by the hotel clerk/owner was infuriating. An apology, an explanation, an offer to cover our parking fee, anything showing concern, would've gone a long way.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was clean & comfortable. The cleaning staff was accommodating, if a little confused about the difference between pillows & blankets.
review.negativeRemarks: The attitude. San Francisco may have a constant flow of new tourists, but there should still be some concern for the people in your facility then.

review.title: Disappointing hotel
review.reviewText: When I booked a room with Expedia, the receipt explicitly said, Your room will be guaranteed for late arrival.  I called the hotel at around 10:00 pm to make sure there was a room.  The manager said the room is ready.  When my husband and I arrived at the hotel around 12 MN, we werent given the room we reserved for;  instead of giving us a 1 king-size bed, we were given 2 double beds.  The manager said we will change rooms the next day.  We left the hotel the following day for a sightseeing.  We put the Do Not Disturb sign on the door since I didnt have time to hide away our valuables and private stuff.  When we returned, our room was empty.  I went to the managers office to inquire.  He said he gave us another room and he gave me the new keys.  All our stuff were in a room that was not yet cleaned.  Trash was everywhere, the dirty linens used by previous occupants were on the floor.  I called the manager and asked that the room be cleaned and the linens changed.  About 15 minutes later, two ladies arrived.  One of them who did not even acknowledge our presence was on her cell phone while putting on new pillow cases.  She was then going to put the linen from the floor back on the mattress and I interrupted her by saying that those were used by previous occupants.  She insisted (in Spanish) those were clean but I told her those were from the floor. She finally gave in to my request after mumbling in Spanish and saying KABRON.  I reported her to the manager but the lat
review.negativeRemarks: customer service

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText: They had a nice bathroom .... so that matters. Its also a good location within the city we felt safe. Other than that it was a bit of a headache. We had a terrible time checking in - started calling to let them know we were still coming, but would be later than expected due to delays at the airport, but no one picked up the phone. (8 calls) When we arrived the lobby was locked (as sign said it would be after 11pm) but no one answered the buzzer at the night window. Buzzing for 10+ minutes. Tried calling a few more times, no answer. Finally called Days Inn reservation services and they must have been able to reach the staff because then they came to the window. Half asleep and impatient. We asked where to park since the lot was full and he said to park right out front by the days inn sign. We did and then ended up with a $70 ticket in the morning. The room was supposed to have a queen size bed, pretty sure it was a full size. Long hair in the pillow case (very visible) plus some stains, stains on the sheets, window screen broken. But the bathroom was nice! Overall, not impressed. It wouldn't have taken much to do a lot better.
review.negativeRemarks: the people that run it
review.locationRemarks: easy to get on the bus and get anywhere in SF

review.title: Hotel in Lombard
review.reviewText: We stayed this hotel for 2 days .. except this hotel being near to city and fisherman's wharf , everything was disappointing .. only 2 good features free parking and location .. internet was bad  and continetal breakfast was joke .. they had just coffee and some store brought baked goods .. thats it .. dont waste ur money on this hotel if u find something simliar ..
review.negativeRemarks: just give good breakfast
review.locationRemarks: fisherman's wharf and peir 39 is some miles ..

review.title: Never coming back again?
review.reviewText: they said breakfast included, but just a few piece bread, very bad
Walking distance to shops and restaurants. Close to bus stop

review.title: Pricey
review.reviewText: The hotel is fine overall but it was pricey. The location is great. For the price I paid better hotels can be find.

review.title: Do not stay here!
review.reviewText: This motel is dirty, the stairs unsafe and staff totally unhelpful!  There are better places in the area to stay!

access to parking is difficult unless you drive a golf cart.

room dcor is depressing

bed and linens not at all comfortable

very noisy, smell of cigarette smoke throughout hotel is very prevalent
