parking can't be imp  doesn't have the space
the room we stayed in had a hanger rack right next to the bathroom.  I hit my shoulder on it a few times

review.title: San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Room smell so bad. Carpet need to be replaced, so dirty.
Breakfast is just coffee, pastries and bananas. No breakfast setting area, You have to take it in your room or stand up at the reception 
Hotel staff was nice.
Location is good.

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText: Price was low compared. To other hotels. Parking isfree

review.title: Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The experience was disappointing. We have stayed at other Days Inn hotels but this one by far was the most disappointing one. The breakfast was just a few bananas and a dry looking piece of pastry. There was no one to replenish the items, when the stock runs out. There is no room to sit down and have breakfast. It would be better that they do not advertise free breakfast as this is misleading information. The hotel staff can not be bothered as there is no one sitting at the check in. No one answers the phone. The bed sheets are not replaced daily even when requested. Days Inn chain should seriously consider if they want to continue to keep it under their banner. We had booked this hotel hoping that it would be similar to other Days Inn where we had stayed.
review.negativeRemarks: A lot could be improved. Please see my comments above.
review.locationRemarks: Good restaurants and proximity to Golden Gate Bridge.

review.title: Very clean, good value
review.reviewText: I was looking for something on Lombard specifically and found the Days Inn to be the best price, something under $140. The check in staff was friendly, the check out lady where I dropped the key seemed irritated, but I had a very clean and comfortable room. I felt safe too which is important.
review.negativeRemarks: There is a window for key drop of, but when you pass the key through the window it comes back to you.
review.locationRemarks: Ward, union square.

review.reviewText: Hotel was much nicer inside than expected. Modern and renovated, great amenities. Great location.

review.title: Nice hotel close to shops and restaurants
review.reviewText: The owner, Andy is extremely helpful and very kind!  He allowed us to cancel our reservation without Expedia keeping our fees in order to upgrade to a larger room and allowed us to keep our rental car parked at the facility even before and after our reservation, which did I mention is free parking?! I typically stay in higher end hotels such as Marriott's, however, this hotel was a delightful surprise! Very clean, nice spacious one-bedroom (two-bedroom is a little tight but still a nice size for being in the city), friendly and helpful staff! Though it is not close to the main attractions, there is easy access to all of them by means of bus which is very cheap and conveniently located off Chestnut and Pierce (take bus 30). The only thing I would have to say is the pictures of the breakfast area are not real. There is no "hot breakfast" but simply options for coffee, apple or orange juice and a variety pack of sugary snacks for a pastry. Overall, for the quality, money and easy access to everything, I would definitely book another stay again!
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean, quite and close to local restaurants, bakeries and shops off of Chestnut street. The staff is very friendly and helpful!
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast could defiantly use improvement. An assortment of fresh muffins, fruit and cereals would have been better then packaged sugary items.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is conventionally located near restaurants and shops located off Chestnut. Easy access to main attractions by means of bus which is cheap!

review.reviewText: Great location, fridge wasn't cold enough, great parking, nice neighborhood!

review.title: It was close to the beach
review.reviewText: Close to all the bus stops, close to the beach and other attractions. Toilets were very loud and stairs were very small hard to park in hotel... But I would stay there again.

review.title: Hotel on Lombard
review.reviewText: The hotel is ok. You are right on Lombard, close to most things. It is very difficult to get in and out of the parking lot and there is not a lot of parking, spaces are very tight. Staff were nice during the day, but the afternoon and evening staff were short and did not speak English very well. Free breakfast goes fast and is mainly juice, coffee, and pastries. Not something that hangs around for more than an hour, but it is close to some very nice restaurants and coffee shops. Overall, you get what you pay for.
review.negativeRemarks: The staff could be more helpful.

review.title: good value
review.reviewText: small but all thing includedwith a good price and do not needs to worry about cleaness and safety.Good position suitable for a short trip

review.title: The wost experience
review.reviewText:
1. The check-in was 2 p.m. When we arrived at 3 p.m. the room was not ready yet.
2. The personal is the least helpful and some members are simply rude. They may 
talk to you from their service room without appearing at the counter, openly express
their unwillingness to communicate, answer only to the direct questions, e.s when
asked at 5 p.m. is parking is available in downtown they answer "no", but after 6 p.m. 
parking is free almost everywhere. 
3. We stayed just for one night. The check-in time 2 p.m.  and the check-out - 11 a.m.
When we arrived at 3 p.m. the room was not ready, but the next morning we were reminded
at 9 a.m. that we have to leave.
4. The rooms are renovated and quite good but the management is terrible. The blankets are 
thing and dusty. During the night the temperature was 46 F. We tried to warm the room using
there weather control system. It sounded terrible - like an airplane at the take-off. 
So, we slept the night dressed in sweaters.
5. The Internet is a fiction - there was no internet connection during our stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Complete change of the staff, starting with  the managers.
review.locationRemarks: The location is good.

review.title: Still dealing with lice/bead bugs from my stay
review.reviewText:
I arrived early and was graciously put into a room before normal check in time by the manager.  That's the best thing I can say about this place. 
The room I was put into was on the street side, and even though the manager said they have noise abatement,  it was brutally loud. A closed window doesn't count as nose abatement. 
The Internet didn't work; the alcove outside my room smelled of urine; the continental breakfast was packaged danish and terrible coffee; the manager took an hour to unlock my bathroom door (with a screw driver) that was left locked by the cleaning staff; when I went to the front desk all I got was a shout from the back room, they couldn't even come out to talk me.
Most importantly when I laid down I immediately felt crawlies. I should have left then,  but the room looked clean so I thought it was my imagination. I now have lice  or bread bugs or some similar itchy bugs to deal with. Absoutely gross. 
Do NOT stay here.

review.title: Horrible
review.reviewText: No parking for all guests... had to park 5 blocks away. Room was never vacuumed, and bathroom sink was clogged for entire stay. Could not hang any cloths as dresser was under the hang rack.  Will never stay there again.

review.title: Good location. Room small but had all I needed.
review.reviewText: Short stay but nice. Good price. Not much more to add to this review.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to where I needed to be
review.negativeRemarks: Someone opened the room door while I was still there. No knocking on the door.
review.locationRemarks: Not applicable

review.title: Breakfast
review.reviewText: The continental breakfast was awful. Green bananas and some kind of pie. Nothing to start up day for a kids.

review.title: Days Inn
review.reviewText: The Internet was not working the entire stay (5 nights).  The remote of the TV was not working either.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location and room is clean. Free parking

review.reviewText: spotty internet at best, light and fan in bathroom didn't work, poor jerry rig to fix was awkward. Living room lamp on bathroom counter.
It is good but WiFi did not work. Hotel has parking what is very important for San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: WiFi did not work

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText: Have us key to wrong room and walked in on strangers. Continental breakfast a joke. Housekeepers rude. Front desk never answers phone. Nice location and free parking.
It's a good experience for a one night stay! The room is pretty small but the price it's not bad!

review.title: Basic Accommodations
review.reviewText: The overall appearance of the hotel is like a time warp to the fifties. The room was simple at best. Bed covers were paper thin and barely covered the bed. The sink in the bathroom wouldn't drain. TV had closed captioning permanently on. Fridge hadn't been cleaned when we checked in and food and spills remained from the previous occupant. The desk clerk's response to any request was that he'd see to it and then ignore It. "Breakfast" seemed to be packaged buns from a rack and a juice box. At least parking was provided. Certainly not a place I would recommend or consider returning to.
review.negativeRemarks: Almost everything, but at least start by having staff who simply got off their butt and did something about requests for service.
review.locationRemarks: Chestnut Street is a block away and filled with great shops and restaurants. The Marina district is very nice and a convenient place to tour from.

review.title: One towel per customer.
review.reviewText:
When we checked in there was not enough towels for the three people registered for the room. The front desk was able to scavenge up more towels. The next day the cleaning ladies took out the towels we hung to reuse and replaced them only with bath towels. When we retuned late that evening we asked the front desk for more towels we were told to wait until morning. We had a 7am flight.  

We asked the front desk where to purchase a transit day pass and were directed to Union Square.  All we needed to do was walk a block in either direction to Walgreens.
review.positiveRemarks: The room seemed clean and modern.  It was packed with amenities and very comfortable.  I liked the skylight in the bathroom. Convenient location.
review.negativeRemarks: The front desk should have extra towels on standby that's hotel 101.  They should know the area because I don't.  They have a lot to learn.
review.locationRemarks: Great location.  Transit to all the tourist spots is only steps away.  Great restaurants and shopping just around the block.

review.title: Downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: Very inconvenient, noisy area, staff is very rude, the place smells, bedsheet and comforters are dirty.

review.title: I wouldn't again.
review.reviewText: The bathroom lights broken and unable to use the restroom in the dark. I wasn't able to reach hotel staff any of the 5times I called. The walls in the place had more dirt than the parking lot and a mysterious substance on the wall that was either blood or sad to say poop. Only decent thing was the parking and the night attendant was nice.

review.title: Location, location, location
review.reviewText:
For what I paid on Expedia, this hotel was a steal. It wasn't the nicest hotel I've ever stayed in, but it was also far from the worst. It was adequate, and had been updated recently. As long as you only need the room and not many amenities or perks and services, it's perfectly fine. I was within easy walking distance of more amazing food than you can imagine. The "continental breakfast" was a joke- a coffee urn and packaged honey buns, but who cares when the *best coffee in San Francisco* is 4 doors down? Easy bus access to the Presidio, Golden Gate Bridge, and Golden Gate Park, within walking distance of the trendy Union Street shopping district. I also found Japantown, the Embarcadero and the Exploratorium, and more accessible by a reasonable bus ride. Since I was busy all the time, I wasn't spending a ton of time there anyway, so I was quite satisfied with the price for what I got. I had some noisy neighbors the second night, but the hotel management did come and talk to them. 
For folks on a budget, this meets a lot of needs. I'd recommend it, and as long as you don't expect a mint on your pillow, I think you'll feel the same.
review.negativeRemarks: A bag check would be ideal, but with their limited space I can see why they don't offer it.
review.locationRemarks: Right on Lombard, easy access to Golden Gate Bridge and Park, TONS of restaurants and shopping

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: Good location for our needs... Walking distance to inexpensive & good Chinese Restaurant...Parking was available... Heater did not work... Manager's unresponsiveness made me feel that this was not a new problem.  We were attracted to this hotel for the free continental breakfast. Not available for our stay... Again from the manager's lack of concern I got the feeling that it was common for breakfast to be unavailable. Room was small, but judging the area small hotel rooms may be the norm. We will avoid this place in the future.
review.negativeRemarks: heat to the rooms, breakfast as advertised
review.locationRemarks:
about 1 1/2 miles (walking distance) from Fisherman's Wharf
Good Restaurants (Chinese, at least) within a couple of blocks

review.title: Close to palace of fine arts
review.reviewText: No continental breakfast.  Bathroom is small.  Room clean.

review.title: clean motel close to good restaurants.
review.reviewText: on lombard street with reasonably priced taxi access to union square and fishermans wharf
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast

review.reviewText: Though a smaller hotel room count wise, the room we had was spacious and very clean. There was always a place to park for free - a major draw to this hotel. It is also only a 10 minute walk from mariana green and the front desk was always kind. Would highly recommend to anyone looking for a reasonably priced hotel in the city but still within walking distance of major sight-seeing spots and food.
review.positiveRemarks:
- close to spots we came to see
- friendly staff
- free parking and wireless
- room always clean
- quiet hotel even though along busy street
review.negativeRemarks: nothing, great stay!!!
review.locationRemarks:
- great location, easy walking distance to many locations - ie:
- mariana green
- fisherman's wharf
- golden gate bridge

review.title: Go somewhere else
review.reviewText: The room had a really bad smell to it. I was never given the wifi info had to call for it. Tv didn't work phoned front desk twice, got no answer. Finally had to walk to the office. It did come back on after an hour.  Breakfast is an absolute joke--some prepackaged pastries and terrible coffee in tiny cups-but you wouldn't want more.      Pay more and go somewhere else!
review.negativeRemarks: Housekeeping. Place need a seriously good cleaning. Shampoo carpets
review.locationRemarks: Marina district. Plenty to see and do

review.title: New rooms
review.reviewText: Location is on 101 so convenient; easy to get in and out of.  Rooms look to be newly renovated and parking was secure.  Restaurants and convenience stores nearby.
review.negativeRemarks: the staff were pretty useless
review.locationRemarks: We walked to the waterfront and took public transportation back!

review.title: Wouldn't stay again unless we have to
review.reviewText: Room has no AC unless paying $50 extra per evening

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: This was our first time in SF and this hotel was great! Plenty of places to go for food groceries etc within walking distance as well as about 40 min walk to the warf! Next time I go to SF again ill definately be looking to stay here!

review.title: Strong odor of disinfectant, marginal TV  viewing
review.reviewText: It was a convenient room for the night, steep stairs.

review.title: Nice hotel and free parking
review.reviewText: It's quiet and clean hotel. I'll recommend this hotel to friends

review.title: OK hotel for price.
review.reviewText: We stayed in this hotel because most hotels in SF are very expensive this time of year. This hotel was less expensive and in a safe location. We would have preferred to stay closer to Union Square, but this was okay for the price.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms are small, but clean.  Parking is included in the price. The hotel was quiet at night.
review.negativeRemarks: The "continental breakfast" is minimal. We bought breakfast at a nearby bakery.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is close to Chestnut Street which has lots of cute shops and restaurants.  We enjoyed a great hike to the Presidio, Lyon's gate, etc.

review.title: Decent hotel  close to Chesnut Street Shops
review.reviewText: Friendly staff and helpful with free parking before and after check in. Good location with easy access to main attractions in San Francisco
review.locationRemarks: Very close to great restaurants/cafes and delis on Chestnut Street. Safe area.

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and no bed bugs. it was great to have parking at the hotel. if you wanted a bus. the bus stop was just down the street. the bay was just a few blocks down the street.
review.positiveRemarks: for what I paid, it was great
review.negativeRemarks: Have the cleaning ladies leave the a/c on when they leave.
review.locationRemarks: I was close to everything, but not in the middle of everything

review.title: Days inn
review.reviewText: The hotel in and of itself was good.  It's a good place for the money especially for the free parking.  That being said I booked a room with two doubles and got a queen.  When I went to shower water was squirting out of the connection of the shower head to pipe.  I later adjusted and fixed the o-ring and was no longer squirting all over.  I would recommend staying here again.

review.title: wow! so much better than hotel across the street!!
review.reviewText: The room we were in had just been remodeled. everything was freshly painted, new & nice.
review.positiveRemarks: It was clean & most everything in the room was new or in good condition
review.negativeRemarks: parking is tight
review.locationRemarks: close to public transportation & waterfront less than a mile away.

review.title: Good location, Mediocre hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a good location for Fisherman's wharf, the golden gate bridge, and Lombard st.  But it is really cheap and you get what you pay for. Rooms are directly accessible from outside. Customer service here was pretty poor, the front desk wasn't very friendly and didn't want to talk anymore than he absolutely had to.

review.title: Great price, great location, great staff!
review.reviewText: Accidentally double booked a room and didn't realize until after check in and the staff was wonderful with setting it right for us.  Rooms were clean, safe and comfortable.  Rooms were a bit on the small side but so is everything in San Francisco.  Off street parking was a huge plus and the location was perfect.  We spent time eating in north beach and on chestnut and golfed in the presidio! A great weekend and we will be back!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: No complain. Its clean and has a great location. No much room comfort since its very small but I would stay there again, specially because of its location and price
review.positiveRemarks: Price and location (its is also clean)
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast if possible
review.locationRemarks: Great location, with nice stores and restaurants near by.

review.title: Small outdated rooms
review.reviewText: The room was very small. It tightly fits two full sized beds and the walls are reachable with hands when sitting down on beds. It's very compact in design. The driveway in and out of hotel entrance is always backed with traffic. Also the building is pretty outdated. While the location itself is convenient for visiting San Francisco, the lack of amenities and tight space make it a reluctant choice for future use.
We were next to the staircase and it was noisy all morning with people exiting. Other than the poor room location, the room was great. It was in a great location and renovated recently.

review.title: Hotel San Fran
review.reviewText: Priced well for area and simply hotel for sleep and shower. No juice machine working, No coffee till 8 am as compared to normal 6 am., weak wifi needs to be N type for signal strength, key programmed for one day rather that 3 day of reservation, motion lights in room annoying as they light up any time some one moves in room.

review.title: Good overall
review.reviewText: It was quite, which is good for being right downtown.

review.title: Not far away from attractions by a short bus ride
review.reviewText: A small hotel but each room has a parking space in a enclosed patio like setting below the rooms. I found it nice that it was a smaller hotel with not as many people. The front desk staff were helpful. My only complaint is about the cleaning lady. When I first got there I noticed we only had 1 towel so I went and asked for more towels and she was reluctant to give them to me. I went back to the room and shortly after noticed there wasn't any soap. When I asked her she just pushed her cart towards me not saying anything. The next morning 2 hours before check out she barged into our room I guess thinking it was empty! That definitely didn't impress me. I would stay here again, but hopefully they get another cleaning person.
review.positiveRemarks: Good price for a one night stay and included parking
review.negativeRemarks: Customer service and friendliness of the cleaning personnel.
review.locationRemarks: Ihop, restaurants and stores near by on Chestnut Quick bus ride to the fillmore

review.title: Small rooms. Free parking which was key.
review.reviewText: it was a good location. Small rooms. Comfortable beds. Just OK. But a Days Inn.

review.title: Nice place close to the wharf..
review.reviewText: Enjoyed staying at this motel.. Will stay net time around very nice!!

review.title: Not as advertised
review.reviewText: Door to room broken. No extra pillows upon request. Website lies; no airport shuttle. Had to arrange fir taxi and pay 3x as much.

review.title: Non-responsive staff
review.reviewText: The heater in my room wa snot working - I asked to look at it in the morning. In the afternoon-nothing happened. I asked fro the second blanket Waited. Asked again. Eventually got it. Next day - still no heat. Asked for the third blanket . Th y said they will put it into the room. Nothing happened. I asked again next day - same story. Every morning I wanted to get coffee at 7AM - the office was always closed! But otherwise the location is great and the rooms are clean and comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: Staff should actually learn how to make lives of guests a little bit easier
review.locationRemarks: Marina district - nice walks to see the bayviews, bus takes you anywhere in 15-20 min, plenty of decent ethnic restaurants

review.title: Terrible!
review.reviewText: I will never stay here again! No parking, poor customer service, dirty, tv didn't work. Just awful!

review.title: Clean hotel, close to Marina District and Busses
review.reviewText: Great hotel - small room but I was surprised at how clean it was. We stayed for 6 nights and received fresh bed linens and clean towels every day, regardless of what time we left the room. Close to everything you need to be close to in San Fran. Great place for people on a budget
They have free parking space. Room is ok for short time living.

review.title: Great Place!
review.reviewText: There were 2 of us staying there and it was great. I paid less than $100.00 per night and it was clean, quiet and centrally located. We walked to Fisherman's Warf one night, reasonably close to Moffitt Hospital ( our main reason to visit the city) and not to far from Ocean Beach to drive for a bon Fire on the beach! I loved the fact that most of the rooms are above the parking lot so you do not have people above or below you, also that all the rooms windows are facing one another. That really seemed to help keep the traffic noise down. We will defiantly be returning to this location. Thank you!
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, Quiet, Felt safe in and around location
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Warf, bus stops, food, bars

review.title: Easy and clean
review.reviewText: We showed up at 11 on New Year's eve. They had our key ready. For the price and location we were at, this is an amazing deal!

review.title: Terrible hotel & staff
review.reviewText: This is the worst hotel of my trip in US! Hotel staff is very very terrific! He didn't do anything to help the guests. I had problem with turning on TV and call for his help. He said I have to wait until tomorrow! So I fixed by myself! Very very late breakfast (around 8.30 am)!!!

review.title: Close to all we wanted to do!
review.reviewText: Great hotel ~ close to everything we wanted to do ~ friendly and helpful staff ~ clean room...perfect for our trip!

review.title: Near restaurants, bars & stores.
review.reviewText: We arrived late at night and the clerk awoke & gave us our room key. Parking was tight but a free spot was guaranteed with our room reservation. The rooms were very small but the motel was well maintained and we would stay there again.
review.locationRemarks: Many good restaurants, bars, and stores are along Chestnut or Union which are within walking distance.

review.title: Not quite
review.reviewText: We were given a dark corner room with very little natural light. Three of us staying in the one room, it was very cramped. The staff were not very helpful, until checkout day when they allowed us to keep our park till later in the day. Much appreciated. The toilet made a lot of noise running water at all times. We asked them to fix it and they told us to turn it off at the wall, not a satisfactory solution. On the positive side, the room was very clean.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, and easily accessible via bus routes.
review.negativeRemarks: See above
review.locationRemarks: Some good restaurants in the parallel street. Easy access to downtown, waterfront, Golden Gate Bridge and Haight Asbury area.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
Close to the marina, the Golden Gate Bridge - spectacular views a short walk away - great area for restaurants and just walking around. Easy access to public transportation, Free parking. Great area for jogging and biking - you can do the hills if you want or go towards the water where it's nice and flat.

It doesn't have all the amenities - but it's a bargain.
review.locationRemarks: Many restaurants, bookstore nearby, near the marina, movie theatre, easy access to tour buses, plenty to do

review.title: Good for a one nighter
review.reviewText: From previous reviews we anticipated a problem with parking but were lucky enough to get a space before it filled up. They have twice as many rooms as spaces. Come early and don't move the car. Nice neighborhood, some nice little restaurants and bars. The rooms are old, the AC unit was loud, but overall clean and the bathroom was clean sufficient. It was a place to put our bags and get a nights sleep. It was god and economical for that. It's not a place you would spend any amount of time at. I found the staff willing to help and give suggestions about local venues etc. I would stay again.
review.positiveRemarks: Served its purpose for one night
review.negativeRemarks: The AC unit was loud and the there is not enough parking spots. Otherwise, no surprise for the money and the city

review.title: Not a good deal
review.reviewText: Chose a place with breakfast and it consisted of some stale packages Danishes, bananas, watery juice and coffee, all located at the front desk. The second day they had no food and put up a sign that they were out (I went down at 8 am). I booked through Expedia for for people including two adults and two 12 year olds, arriving to one bed. They said they would be providing some sort of beds for the kids and finally at 10:30 p.m. they arrived with a very small box spring, that barely fit one of the kids and the springs were in poor condition.

review.title: Easy exces with car
review.reviewText:
Nice motel for the price in a big city. Free parking is a big plus.
They better advertise without breakfast, than you don't get disappointed
By the in plastic (months ago) wrapped cookie.
review.positiveRemarks: One block from chestnut street nice food and shopping
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Close by Marina, public and tourist bus in front of the door.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Had to ask for hand towel then they didn't even have any to give. Light fixture in hall to bathroom was gone so very dark. Room tempature was hard to regulate.
review.negativeRemarks: More towels better lighting
review.locationRemarks: The wharf

review.title: The location was close to the munis bus.
review.reviewText: My family and I arrived in the morning we were surprised that the door of the hotel was locked and no one was there. We had to put our luggages in the basement until we were able to check in later in the day. One of the lights and the small refrigator ws working in the room. I called mutiple times to have it fix before someone came in to check it out. The front desk person needs to be more welcoming and friendlier. Sevice needs to be improve.
review.negativeRemarks: Sevice needs to be improve. The staff needs to greet, smile and be friendly.
review.locationRemarks: There a lot small stores, and restaurants.

review.title: Days Inn on Lombard perfect choice!
review.reviewText: This hotel was easy to find, location was perfect for our stay in San Francisco. Loved that they had off-street parking as well. The only negatives for us were the room had an overwhelming smell of cleaning products. You know, the amonia type smell - it was very strong. The other thing was that their breakfast was not served until 8 am!! I think it was only donuts and coffee, but still. There is an I-Hop across the street, so all was not lost. This hotel is located very close to the bus line (a block away), so once you figure out the schedules, you will be good-to-go in getting around San Francisco. The bus line has a website that we found very easy to understand and was quite helpful in planning our outings around the city. The bus drivers themselves are not very friendly though.
review.positiveRemarks: Location!! It was a good sized room and well set-up for our needs as well.
review.negativeRemarks: The front desk person was hard to understand. He was friendly enough, just hard to understand.
review.locationRemarks: Many good restaurants and bars within walking distance. We really enjoyed Monahan's (hopefully I'm spelling it correctly).

review.title: Wow - really small room and not very nice.
review.reviewText: Customer service is non-existent. No breakfast to speak of, just old coffee cakes and a few bananas. You have to bring your own cups for coffee. The rooms are tiny, no desks to work from and the Internet is poor. The rooms are old and not that clean. I asked for a tooth brush because they advertise that they have sundries at the front desk and the attendant sent me to Walgreens to buy my own. Not a place I would ever stay again.
review.negativeRemarks: So much!!!! Customer service is a start!

review.title: Good location for price
review.reviewText: For the price & location, you can't beat it. The room is extremely warm without a window wide open, which made it loud at times. The "breakfast" is a joke--don't bother. No hand towels provided--only shower & washcloths. Didn't clean up coffee area in room each day. Otherwise, a nice place to sleep & shower, and get to everything.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast and cleaning each morning."
review.locationRemarks: Super location for price--Marina district--easy to get to everything."

review.title: Nice room
review.reviewText: It was very clean, it looked new, even the room was small it was comfortable. Was great because of the free parking and the free wireless, because in San Francisco is hard to find a hotel with free parking.
review.locationRemarks: It was good that was near the Golden Gate Bridge, and near an Ihop to take the breakfast. I guess It is in one of the important streets of S.F.

review.title: Super Clean
review.reviewText: When I checked reviews for this hotel online they were mixed, we were pleasantly surprised. The parking lot was spotless when we arrived as were the walkways. The parking issues are very real, it's a tight space and spots are limited. We got there early and used public transportation during our stay. Our room was small, no table and chairs, but up dated and very clean. Bathroom was spotless. Staff were friendly as well. Breakfast consisted of a packaged pastry, orange or apple juice and bananas. But it was a clean, affordable place to stay in S.F. Close to Fishermans Wharf.

review.title: Nice Hotel in tourist friendly location
review.reviewText: Cnveniently located , nearby restaurants, well connected by Local transport. Take 30x for Financial district or use your own car. Good and safe neighbourhood.
review.positiveRemarks: Decent fellow occupants. The hotel was full but no disturbance by anyone during night, which is common in Lombard st hotels.
review.negativeRemarks: nil
review.locationRemarks: Tourist friendly llcation

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: The hotel room was small but nice. We never had a problem with parking. We enjoyed the refrigerator, microwave, coffe maker, and hair dryer in the room. It was within walking distance of plenty of restaurants and nightlife. Great location.
review.locationRemarks: Great location for walking around.

review.title: Don't go there for longer than a day
review.reviewText: We arrived there past the check-in time but our room was still not ready. We were given another room with a little window, almost none.

review.title: Not recommended
review.reviewText: Found reception very unhelpful and breakfast non existant. You were virtually on your own - arrived after check-in time stated but room was not ready and was told Expedia had check-in time incorrect! Was a very basic motel and a long way away from Fisherman's Wharf.
review.locationRemarks: Too far away from Fisherman's Wharf - not within walking distance - had to take a bus from Chesnut Street.

review.title: Small, but good
review.reviewText: First reaction was not so good with having to use stairs to bring luggage up and rooms were a little small. After we got over that, we were glad there was a fridge and microwave since we had a lot of leftovers from all the good restaurants around. The colors of the room were nice and the room had a surprisingly modern look. The lights all have sensors which have annoying blinking green lights as you sleep, which we covered up with the curtain promptly when sleeping. Overall it was good, especially for the price (SF is expensive!).
review.negativeRemarks: no elevator to bring up luggage bags, very puny "lobby", rooms are small (but decorated very well), blinking lights
review.locationRemarks: Lots of food around, transportation to get to SF areas is great

review.title: Nothing to write home about
review.reviewText: The front desk clerk refused to return the credit card carbon imprint upon checkout (made me nervous about potential identity theft). The parking in the hotel lot was extremely tight & remodeling was in progress. Construction & remodeling materials were stacked in front of most of the parking stalls making it impossible to pull your car all the way forward. Our room did not have any windows other than one front one, which faced the parking courtyard & upstairs walkway, no elevator & lots of stairs. For privacy we kept the curtains closed which made the room very claustrophobic. The room did offer a microwave and mini fridge, which was nice. The beds were quite firm and uncomfortable & the HVAC unit was very noisy.
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive for location & overall condition/location.
review.locationRemarks: Difficult to see upon approach, hard to pull in with pedestrian traffic, very tight parking for economy car.

review.title: Satisfied in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
We had a wonderful time in San Francisco, we loved the area the hotel was in, nothing fancy, it was comfortable and relatively clean, staff was very friendly, even at 11:00 at night when we returned to the room and the key wouldn't work.
Just a heads up if you stay at the back end of the hotel there is a night club close by that you will hear until around 2am, we were too tired to let it bother us.
We had a newly renovated room and they were working on others, bad timing to do this in the summer but very necessary, it will be clean and comfortable throughout the hotel when they complete it.
Continental breakfast is very basic, if your looking for more than coffee, banana and a packaged danish, there are many great restaurants in the area. We stayed at the hotel for one and a half weeks and would return in a heart beat, just make sure you get it for a good price.

review.title: Recent renovations make this a great hotel...
review.reviewText: We were slightly apprehensive due to the previous reviews about this hotel, but our fears were unfounded. Our room was recently renovated, clean, and comfortable. The free parking was a definite asset, and we enjoyed our stay. If I were to come back to San Francisco, I would stay here again. You can't beat the value or the location. Fisherman's Wharf is a short drive (park at the Holiday Inn Express on North Point and Taylor), and there is a Thai Food restaurant next door, and an IHOP just a block away. It worked out well for us.
review.negativeRemarks: Small room, but didn't affect our stay.
review.locationRemarks: Central, close to food and tourist attractions.

review.title: Clean and updated
review.reviewText:
Very nicely updated. Furniture, decor and bathroom were all pretty nice. Fresh paint. Free parking is a big plus. The Expedia reservation said check in was at 2, but it was actually at 3pm, so we ended up waiting a few minutes for our room to be cleaned and ready.

The reservation also said the hotel included breakfast, but the most we ever saw was a single banana that sat in a basket in the office, even though we went down to look at multiple times between 6am and 9am. Not even coffee in the carafes.
review.locationRemarks: Nice area, with many cafes, restaurants, shops and bars within a couple of blocks.

review.title: Nice but small.
review.reviewText: The room we stayed in was just re done and very clean! Everything worked well and the fridge & microwave were a huge plus. The staff was wonderful but the room was very small, much smaller than seemed online. Also, the breakfast was just bananas and coffee. Over all it was fine just overpriced.
review.locationRemarks: Location was safe but kinda far from everything without a car.

review.title: you are better off at the Bates Hotel
review.reviewText:
This hotel has been the worst I've stayed in. I knew we would be staying in a low budget hotel, but I expected the hotel to be somewhat hospitable. The bathroom smelled like an alley way and had urine stains on the floor, door would not close shut. Curtain had mold. It was horrid.
Carpet had stains and the walls were dirty also. The worst were the bed sheets. Not to mention the blanket.... I work in a psych hospital and these blankets were the same we use there!!!!
We were woken up by dogs barking.... I can't remember if this is a pet friendly hotel, which I like. But if you are on vacation and want to sleep in. Don't stay in this hotel with thin walls that will wake you up with barking.
The guy at the front desk is unfriendly and rude.
Please stay elsewhere..... Trust

review.title: Cheap and comfortable -- sort of
review.reviewText:
Currently the hotel is undergoing rennovation, so there's a lot of work noise and materials and discarded hotel furniture in the courtyard. Sometimes there was no hot water at night. The room was very small and in need of upgrades and repairs. The lobby is about 4' x 4' and not very attractive with very limited amenities. You have to walk up a steep flight of stairs to get to your room. On the positive side, the management was very courteous and the price was right as well as the location, close to restaurants and transportation and within walking distance of the bay. I guess if you need an economical alternative, this was ok. I
guess I just expected too much.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: Reception area is really small and has an odor. Room was ok for 2 people but the cleanliness and quality was not worth what we paid. Staff were somewhat helpful but when we ask about directions the receptionist had to get someone else to assist as she didn't seem to know too much. We stayed here for one night which was enough. however location is great as it's near the marine and a short bus ride to the fisher mans wharf.
review.negativeRemarks: The room

review.title: Good Value for the Money.
review.reviewText: The room was small, nothing fancy. But it was clean and quiet. Parking is problematic at various times. Staff was pleasant and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking

review.title: Spend the money on somewhere better
review.reviewText: Place was dirty and outdated. Requested a non smoking room and got a smoking room. Requested change to non smoking room and got offered another smoking room with a bigger bed. Customer service was terrible. Bed was dirty and sheets were covered with filth and hair.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything except the location

review.title: kinda run down.
review.reviewText: door was broken. walls had stains. wallpaper ripped. bathroom door was sideways. There was a big bulge in the ceiling ( probably from water leakage?). some mold between cracks in bathroom. only good thing was the free breakfast..which was mediocre.

review.title: Not what was expected
review.reviewText: Initial room assigned full of mold and smelled of urine. aWallnters dirty. Staff was accomadating reassigned our room. Still not terribly clean. No breakfast/coffee in am as was told. Would not go back.

review.title: Not worth any price!
review.reviewText: Beds are bowed and room very smelly. Toilet constantly running. Will not stay here again, not worth the savings!!

review.title: Good basic hotel in downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: We wanted to stay in downtown San Francisco and not spend a lot of money. This hotel had parking, a frig and microwave. The hotel was older and room was small but clean and perfect for our needs. We got a room in the back and it was fairly quiet too.
review.negativeRemarks: Older building and small room
review.locationRemarks: Right off Lombard Street, great big city feel.

review.title: Cant be beat for the price/location/quality
review.reviewText: It isnt the Hilton, but thats fine by me. The rooms were quaint, and very clean. The free parking feels safe due to its courtyard location, and was very useful. There isn't really a breakfast, but who wants to eat hotel waffles when there is the entirety of SF to explore for food?! The location was great, with quick access to the bus system for transportation to the beach, Haight-Ashbury, the Wharf, anything really. Plenty of food and walking on Lombard at night felt decently safe. Would certainly stay there again considering its more than reasonable prices! Stayed with my girlfriend, we are both 22 years old if that means anything to you.
review.negativeRemarks: didnt give me a spoon at 3 am when i needed one haha
review.locationRemarks: perfect

review.title: hotel needs some maintainance
review.reviewText: booked the hotel for just a day so I was alright. The hotel is not clean. You will have trouble with wireless internet. The staff was flexible about timings of checkin and checkout so that was good.

review.title: Nigthmre at Days Inn
review.reviewText:
Arrived late at night and found food in the microwave , filthy coffee pot and bed bugs in the morning crawling on the sheets. Stayed in a different room second night, the sheets were again stained from bed bugs, could see about 7 sheddings and 2 live ones one the bed.

Customer service was not pleasant.The guy was not interested in his job.

Left in the morning.I will never stay there again.

review.title: san francisco
review.reviewText: The Hotel is undergoing redecoration at the moment and the results are great. The location is ideal for seeing San Francisco, and easy to find, located very well for local cafes and shops

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: woke up to a man sleeping on a cot outside my door. i was blocked in my room.

review.title: Days Inn Disappointment!
review.reviewText: I think the thing that clouded our feeling for this hotel was the lack of assistance on arrival. We arrived at approx 8:30 am and were informed that check-in was at 3:00 pm which we understood but they had nowhere for us to stow our cases (4 adults which suitcases and carry-ons) -it just wasn't an option for us to carry them around with us all day! They finally offered us a room that we could hire for the day (the price of one nights accomodation) - they then said that we could keep that room and that was the room that one of our party actually stayed in!!! We really felt that as we had booked three rooms for 5 nights and that one of our rooms was ready they could have let us just stow our bags there for the day until we could book in - without charging us for an extra day for which they didn't have to do anything!
review.negativeRemarks: The feeling of being ripped off! Lack of service which I have to say was not the norm everywhere we have been very impressed with the service.
review.locationRemarks: Reasonably central.......

review.title: non expensive
review.reviewText: very good for a non expensive hotel !!! the room was clean, everything was working properly, and you can walk wherever you want. even to pier 39 or the golden gate. perfect location !

review.title: Expecting more.
review.reviewText: Location was ok, but condition of the room was disappointing. Very small and bathroom was oddly designed and awkward.

review.title: The heating in the room did not work.
review.reviewText: During the first night in the room the heating did not work, so the room was really cold. The next day however we received a small heater.

review.title: Handy for my needs
review.reviewText: Am only somewhat familiar with San Francisco so the location was easy for me to find and get to and from where I needed to go. My stay was pleasant. My only concern was making the turn into the driveway approach; it was kinda tight with traffic pushing behind me and cars parked on both sides of the entrance. Overall, here is where I'd stay again. The room rate was within my budget and I appreciated that when many other places charged much more and had some poor reviews.
review.locationRemarks: Simply am not familiar with San Francisco to be able to answer this question.

review.title: Too noisy.
review.reviewText: Loud, staff was lazy, room was smelly.

review.title: Hotel was exactly what I needed.
review.reviewText: The location was within 2 miles of almost everything I came to San Francisco for. I was looking for just a place to sleep without breaking the bank and this was it. Clean and simple, not a whole lot of extras, but I don't need them.

review.title: never again!!!
review.reviewText: run down, needs updated. over priced for room quality.

review.title: Basic motel, cheap but not nasty
review.reviewText:
Downsides: small room, dated, noisy road outside, abrupt hotel staff.
Pros: cheap, good location for fishermans wharf, clean, free wifi and so cheap!

No bed bugs or any hygeine problems like those mentioned by others. Clean enough and great price.

review.title: Won't go back!
review.reviewText: Left sweater in room upon checkout. Went back to retrieve; manager said "no one turned it in". Of course not! He wouldn't even consider asking maid service or maintenance about it! Room was not very clean! Would not recommend to others!

review.title: Bad smell...bed bugs...kinda sucked.
review.reviewText: Stayed here for 3 nights and the room smelled like chlorine. There were definite bed bugs as we left with multiple bites. Mattress was terrible...maid service left our curtains wide open and we were on the ground floor, which coincidentally is right next to the parking lot so we got to hear all the cars driving in and out. AC was extremely loud and went on and off. Pretty much everything about this place sucked except for possibly the location. Unfortunately, this was the cheapest place we could find for the weekend, but in hindsight, I would have preferred to pay twice as much at another hotel for the sanity of staying in a cleaner room. Would definitely NOT recommend.

review.title: Worn
review.reviewText: The hotel is representative of it's pricing. Great for location and it's actually clean, it's just very worn. Excellent and new flat screen tv, room decor and bedding needs a bit of a refresh.

review.title: My ears hurt
review.reviewText:
The worlds noisiest hotel room.

There were loud noises all night. We were on the street side and from 5.30-6.00am it was impossible to sleep.

The receptionist doesn't have the words please or thank you in his vocabulary.

The room was adequate but barely holding together. The bonus was in the free parking.

review.title: Will return to hotel again!
review.reviewText: Considerating the price per night, the hotel was satisfactory. The wifi connection was weak but the room was clean and comfortable. Coffee was good!

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText:
The hotel was pretty much what I was expecting for one of the cheapest hotels in san fran. Beds were comfy and shower worked, wifi was free but with a weak signal. Rooms were clean but bathroom was a bit shoddy.
It's in the marina district which is nice enough and justbwithin walking distance of Fishermans Wharf though you're better off getting the convenient 30 bus.
With hindsight Id have probably spent a bit more and stayed closer to thw wharf.

review.title: Can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: The staff was friendly, especially Andy. He welcomed our arrival and made our stay special by taking care of our extra needs (welcoming our Pomeranian warmly). The room was nice and clean, except for a small blood stain on the sheets. Otherwise I would definitely go back to this great establishment!

review.title: Get what you pay for
review.reviewText:
Travellers should remember that when staying at a Days Inn you are not staying at the Hilton. You get what you pay for- clean, secure, reasonably comforatable basic hotel accomodation that is not in the centre of things.

Had not encounterd any problems with staff at the Days Inn and were fairly helpful the 1 time I asked for tourist info.

review.title: wonderful service
review.reviewText: my stay at the days inn was wondrful it was located right in the middle of everything,from shops,to restaurants,clubs and more. I was more then delightled with the hotel.

review.title: DID NOT LIKE IT AT ALL !!!
review.reviewText:
Unfortunately this is another case of you get what you pay for... We have been to SF many times to visit family and always stayed at a Travelodge. Never had a problem, this time we decided to go for something a bit cheaper....BIG MISTAKE !
The television did not work, the bathroom was dirty, the beds very uncomfortable and to top it all off, we arrived late, asked the night clerk where we could park. He told us to leave the car in a place where it almost got towed ! He could of at least let us know the tow truck was there, good thing my husband is a light sleeper. It still cost us $ 150.00 dlls. Who is going to reimburse us that money ? WE WILL NEVER STAY THERE AGAIN.
Please don't waist your money on this hotel !!!!

review.title: Satisfaction
review.reviewText: This hotel was perfect for my fiance and I! We had a one bedroom queen sized room and it was very clean, comfortable, and decent sized. I wanted to stay in the neighborhood because on previous visits I've found that this area has great public transportation, a good night scene, and it has great places to eat. I've stayed in other hotels in the same neighborhood that aren't bad, but this one has been the best so far.

review.title: Not a complimentary breakfast
review.reviewText:
The compimentary breakfast was not a full breakfast, very very lmited. There was one kind of juice, coffee (stated Folgers on the canister but this was not Folgers), and simple items such as cofee and prepackaged pastries. In addition the faucet in the tub leaked all night, my non smoking room had burn holes in the sheets, I requested extra pillows but never received them, and the bathroom was so small they had to cut a piece of the door off to allow the door to open fully.
Parking is very limited, if the hotel was fully booked you would have a guaranteed parking space.

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText:
The hotel staff was very friendly, even when we rolled in around 5 am due to car troubles. They also allowed a late check out.

Other than the service, there was nothing great about this hotel. If you are looking for spacious, comfortable rooms, this is not the place. The complimentary breakfast was not much to boast about, but it was better than nothing. Kir

review.title: Hotel with NO service
review.reviewText: No service. Rude staff. Stained Towels. Poor Wi-Fi.

review.title: Don't stay here!
review.reviewText: The rudest customer service both on night and day crew. Stay began as a pain in the butt, and ended with a crazy woman at the hotel desk yelling and screaming that she was going to call the police because we complained about how they treated us.

review.title: not impressed, but the cost was great savings....
review.reviewText: good for budget hotel. if you just need a place to sleep after a tiring day. then the money is all worth awhile.

review.title: i left my heart
review.reviewText: it had been 40 years since i had been in san fran........?

review.title: "One of my worst experiences"
review.reviewText:
Terrible, terrible, terrible!!! I have stayed in many Days inn hotels on previous occasions, & have been pleasantly suprised at the good value for money, and therefore went with the same brand for our trip to San Fran. HUGE mistake, It started at the check in, where the 'manager' was totally dis-interested, lack os communication and no customer orientated at all.
The room was not the room we booked (supposed to be a king bed, recieved two single beds) the room STANK of smoke, we had to leave the door open to try and get rid of the smell. The room itself was falling apart, wallpaper peeling off the walls, dirt marks all over, & everything seemed years old.

The "FREE WIRELESS INTERNET" only worked on 1 of the 3 nights, & cut out every few seconds. upon asking the 'manager' he said "is just slow" and went back to his family.

Bathroom was disgusting, more dirt marks on the walls, not cleaned properly, stains of all kinds everywhere, & hair left in the tub.

Breakfast (understandingly, from staying at other days inn) is not much, its normally coffee, juice, some muffins, fruit, etc. but this was (as the rest of the stay was) below par, coffee, and packed pastries.

DO NOT STAY HERE... there are plenty of other hotels/motels along lombard street that Im sure will provide a service (as any service will be better than this hotel). at least I'm sure you'll find one were you will feel welcomed!.

review.title: Poor room, Untruthful manager
review.reviewText: It is listed as Fisherman's Wharf area, but it really is not. The room was pretty bad, could use a renovation. Breakfast is a joke. No elevator, so you have to carry your baggage upstairs because all rooms are in the first floor and nobody helps you. When we arrived we found someone elses baggage and stuffs in the room. We called the manager and he told us that the last guest asked for a late check out and he moved his belongings out. We asked him if they have changed linens, towels and etc. He says yes (what a liar!), but we found that this guest had used the bathroom, and had cut his toes nails and left on the floor. So, we asked the maid to change towels and to clean the room. When she came she confirmed that nothing had been changed. She was very nice and provided to clean the room and change everything. The room is very small and has no place to put your baggage.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The staff at this hotel was very friendly and provided us with a comfortable stay. The location was wonderful. Walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and very accessable to many bus routes that take you all over the city.

review.title: THE HOTEL IS NECESSARY IN ACCORDANCE WITH ITS PRICE
review.reviewText: IS A GOOD HOTEL, GREAT LOCATION, THE ROOM IS GOOD, CLEAN BATHROOM

review.title: Stay away
review.reviewText: The outside of the hotel is very clean and attractive. It looks inviting. However, the room we were in was not acceptable. When we entered there was an overwhelming smell of air freshener/santizer. We should have known than that something was not okay. No dresser or suitcase to place our luggage. Our luggage had to be placed on the floor. The bathroom had moldy grout. No place to put toileteries. The walls were dirty as well. It was very dingy. By the next AM we realized why we had such an overpowering smell of air freshener. The room wreaked of urine. We checked out that AM.

review.title: If you want something cheap, it is enough.
review.reviewText:
It is in a good location, near Pier, downtown, little, confort, Dont aks more for what you paid.
Breakfast is funny... just an orange juice (not enough for all) coffee and a roll.
Clean, small, A/C, LCD, microwave, coffee maker, freeze, thats all Folks...

review.title: Great staff, poor room
review.reviewText: I had paid for, and had comfirmation for, a king bed. It was a double (I didn't know they even made those anymore). The motel management and Expedia worked out a partial refund for us. It is listed as Fisherman's Wharf area, but it really is not. However, within very close walking distance we found great food and easy access to public transportation. We were two women traveling alone and felt safe. The management here was super. Very friendly and helpful, especially Andy. The room was pretty bad, though. Did not seem very clean. It is a very old place. The refrigerator bumped and hummed and clicked all night the first night. I unplugged it the second night. We were in one of just a few rooms right on Lombard and it was very noisy. Parking filled up fast and was limited. Staff assured us we would be taken care of if we came back after dinner and parking was full. I would pay more and stay somewhere else next time. I feel bad about that, in light of the kindness and friendliness of the staff.

review.title: Good Access to Golden Gate Park Polo Field
review.reviewText: Simple hotel in nice area of the Marina District for good food and attractions; easy access to Golden Gate Park.

review.title: What a rip-off
review.reviewText: It's hard to find a cheap hotel in San Francisco, but your money would be better spent somewhere else than here. Besides the stains on the sheets and towels, the hotel was incredibly noisy. We ended up unplugging the fridge in the middle of the night because it sounded like tiny goblins were running around in there. And of course our room had to be under the room with the industrial washing machine which started bumping loudly at 8am on a Saturday morning. Not to mention the bed itself and the pillows were extremely uncomfortable. I really have nothing good to say about this place, and I will never go back again. I wanted a cheap hotel where we could just get a decent night's rest, but rest was the one thing that was lacking. Unfortunately, in downtown SF, you just have to spend a bunch of money to stay somewhere halfway decent.

review.title: Nothing amazing...nothing bad...
review.reviewText: I felt like the hotel was what I paid for it. The staff was pleasant, their parking lot was safe and convenient, the room was OK. For the price and just needing a place to stay, I would definitely stay there again. We walked up the top of Lombard street to see the crookedest street and take the trolley to the Civic Center area... the walk was long, but nice for a little exercise. The neighborhood and Lombard street felt safe. We had no problems at all. Parking and price were my main reasons for choosing this hotel and everything went great.

review.title: You feel like a gaint in a small space.
review.reviewText: Besides the beds being tiny... the breakfast was a joke, and the dog next door was always barking. But the room was clean, and lucky there was a IHOP across the street.

review.title: Perfectly satisfactory
review.reviewText: Fine hotel for the price. Great location. Free parking is a great bonus. Very nice staff. Could use a renovation. Will go again.

review.title: Very good location, reasonably priced.
review.reviewText: This hotel had a very good location right on Lombard Street which was close to restaurants and attractions. The room was adequate and had the convenience of a microwave and mini-fridge. The desk clerks were nice and accomodating. The continental breakfast consisted of hot beverages and orange juice plus prepackaged Danishes and also a few bananas. We usually ate at the IHOP which was close by. There was alot of traffic noise as Lombard is a very busy main street. When you turned on the heat, there was a funky odour. My hisband found the bed hard but I was OK with it. It would have been nice to have a dresser in the room as we kept our clothes in the suitcase for the entire 7 days. It was good hotel at a reasonable price.

review.title: wouldmstay again
review.reviewText: The hotel was in an brilliant location. As we bought a muni pass which was brilliant value and can be used for trams trolley buses and normal buses. The hotel was very clean. The only disappointment was the breakfast only a pastry and coffee. The lobby area where you obtained these from smelt very unsavory. The free car parking was excellent, but filled up very .

review.title: Great Deal
review.reviewText: Great budget hotel close to Palace of Fine Arts and within a 20 minute walk to The Wharf. Room is a great bargain with everything you need (fridge, microwave and flat screen tv.)

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: the only good things about this hotel were the price (cheap) and the free parking. the room was small and didn't seem very clean - the floor was sticky and the towels seemed dirty

review.title: worst hotel we have ever stayed in
review.reviewText: parking sucks. room small. shower curtain was laying in the tub so we couldn't even shower. the sink was about to fall off the wall. will never stay there again.

review.title: What a bargain!
review.reviewText: Some of the reviews for this hotel made me a little worried about our stay. This hotel was fantastic! We had a great room, comfortable bed. Super clean. Flat screen tv, coffee maker, microwave AND fridge. You will not find anything in this price range in the Fisherman's Wharf area with quality like this!

review.title: Good enough...
review.reviewText: Hotel was better than expected for the cheap price and did provide free parking which was a huge plus in this area. The lone inn keeper didn't seem to appreciate me checking in at 1AM in the morning though.

review.title: Good hotel and a bargain.
review.reviewText: This is the second time I stayed at this hotel. For the price it is a good deal. The hotel is comfortable and clean and within walking distance to good restaurants, plenty of nightlife, shopping, Golden Gate Bridge,view of the Bay and public transportation. Do not need a car to get around San Francisco.

review.title: Great hotel for the price
review.reviewText: I was very surprised at the condition of this Days Inn. First off, the Manager was very pleasant and kind. The details in the room I was impressed with was the flat screen tv, the new digital heater/air conditioner. The crown molding in the room and new bathroom sink and skylight in the bathroom. It was obvious that the owners take very good care of this hotel. The only short coming, is as with most hotels in San Francisco, is the narrow and tight parking. But there's nothing the hotel can do about that. I would definately stay there again next year when it's time to bring my daughter home from college. The location is terrific! The Marina district offers lots of good places to eat, get coffee, even drug stores within walking distance. I loved the convenience.

review.title: Very good hotel
review.reviewText: If you're looking for somewhere to crash overnight its perfect. The room was spacious, tidy, clean, and comfortable. That's all we look for in a place to stay.

review.title: Unpleasant
review.reviewText: best that can be said is that the gent at reception was courteous; the rest-wifi didn't work as advertised-sheets had holes;unpleasant smell in room;no continental breakfast as advertised unless coffee alone is considered as same;

review.title: Affordable and convenient
review.reviewText: Good location close to public transportation and within walking distance to restaurants and stores.We had a car too, so free parking was GREAT!Parking space is limited though, coming home late both nights we stayed there, only one spot was left.Lucky my car is tiny, anything larger than a compact would have had to find parking elsewhere.Room was comfortable, but there were some ants crawling on the ceiling. Great place to stay if all you need is a bed and a bathroom, and plan to spend most of your time seeing SF.

review.title: Could've been cleaner
review.reviewText: The service at this hotel was decent however the cleanliness of the room was something to be desired. It was not "dirty" but it did not have a feeling of cleanliness either.

review.title: OK in a pinch
review.reviewText: Rooms small, dark. Bathroom very small with noisy exhaust fan. Mattress old and not supportive. Convenient location. Would return if nothing else available for price.

review.title: good value for Marina district
review.reviewText: This motel was a good value for Marina district, and allowed us to spend money on more important parts of our trip, like eating and going to shows. The location was great because within one block is very good restaurants and nice shops.
